pullRequest.title: Facet Selector integration
pullRequest.bodyText:
#1306
Checklist

 the [contributor license agreement][] is signed
 commit message follows [commit guidelines][]
 tests are included
 screenshots are included showing significant UI changes
 documentation is changed or added

Description of change
This PR attempts to integrate the Facet Selector with Search page. Changes include:

Facet Selector manages the 'Show more/less' buttons by its own state so the extra interface was no longer needed; and
Selected terms are used to generate a Where clause for Search and Facet Search; and
Move the component to a separate MUI Card; and
Only add non-empty Collections to facet search param; and
Modify  interface Classification; and
Strip out the starting /xml for selected Schema node in the Facet dialog.

From the commit history, you may find that some significant changes were made, modified, and reverted. But most importantly, in the end the logic is not so complicated - as long as a term is selected, a search and an update of Classification list will be performed. We also worked out quite a few issues such as the Lucene query relationship between each term and how to avoid the lowercase query issue.

commit.message: Remove the starting '/xml' from selected Schema node.

Add a function to transform standard Classifications to Search page
Classifications.
Update SearchOption to use Map as the type of 'classificationTerms'.
Integrate Facet Selector with Search page.
Update the type of Classification term Map in SearchOption
Move Facet Selector from Refine search panel to its own Card.
Allow to show less categories for each Classification.
Don't include Collections in a Facet search if Collection list is empty.

Make Classification's field 'maxDisplay' not optional.

The value of 'maxDisplay' returned from server won't be undefined. It
can be 0 if it's left empty in the facet configuration dialog. So let
it be 10 if it's 0.
Only show the 'Show more' button when there are more categories to show.
Move selected categories to the top of the list.

Search page significant changes

1. Changing either Search options or selected Terms will
   update the Classification list.
2. Changing Search options also remove all selected terms.
3. When a search is performed is now dependent on the change
   of selected terms.

Allow Facet Selector to manage 'Show more' in its own state.

By doing this, Show more buttons are no longer coupled to the
Search page. And there is no need to remember the status of
these buttons in history.

More changes on Search page state for Classification terms

1. In the end we no longer need a separate state for terms
   selected and move them back to Search options. This
   significantly reduce the complexity of doing a new Search
   and going back to Search page.
2. Classification list now can be updated in two ways. One is
   changing the old Search options (e.g. query and Collections).
   The other way is selecting different terms, which is still
   basically changing Search option. And the terms will be processed
   to be part of the query for retrieving Classification categories.
Place the MUI Card for Facet Selector Search page.
Don't append a '*' to the query for facet search.
Tidy ups for Search page.
Refactor Facet Selector test and Storybook.
Update Search module test and Search Facet module test.

Bring the onchange handler of the Schema node field in
Facet dialog.
Mock function 'listClassifications' in Search page test.
The query for facet search should be consistent with raw mode
Filter out empty Classification terms.
Use 'AND' to concatenate Classification terms.
Update the expected queries for Search module and SearchFacet module tests.
Integration tests for Facet Selector and Search page.
Use Schema node and terms to generate Where clause for search.
Update Jest tests, Storybook and mock data for the Where clause of search.

commit.message: Just import the type of Classification in mock data and update some JSDoc.
Create a new type for selected categories.

Updates for SearchModule, include
1. rename SearchOption's field 'classificationTerms' to
   'selectedCategories' and change its type to Array;
2. Refactor and rename function 'generateWhereQuery'.
Update SearchFacetsModule due to Search Module's changes.

Update Search page to properly integrate Facet Selector.

The handler for selecting categories adds 'schema node' to
each category group because the module needs schema node to
generate a correct where clause.
Update tests, storybook and mock data for Facet Selector.

More tweaks for Facet Selector, including:
1. Rename variable 'showMoreMap' to 'expandedClassifications'
   and modify the logic accordingly.
2. Update function's signature to use proper parameter names.
3. Update some JSDoc.
Tidy ups for Search page test.
Reuse 'queryMuiButtonByText' in Facet Selector test.

Rename FacetSelector to CategorySelector and standardise
the terminology used in tests, storybooks and modules.
Rename the storybook of CategorySelector.

+export interface GategorySelectorProps {
+  /**
+   * A list of Classifications which will be rendered to sections for each
+   * Classifications under which will be the categories as clickable checkboxes.
+   */
+  classifications: Classification[];
+  /**
+   * A list of selected categories which are grouped by their Classification ID.

+   * Handler for selecting/deselecting categories.

+  classifications,

+  onSelectedCategoriesChange,
+}: GategorySelectorProps) => {
+  const classes = useStyles();
+  const [expandedClassifications, setExpandedClassifications] = useState<
+    Map<number, boolean>

+    new Map(classifications.map((classification) => [classification.id, false]))

+   * @param classificationID The ID of a Classification whose SHOW MORE' and 'SHOW LESS' buttons is clicked.

+    copiedMap.set(classificationID, expanded);
+    setExpandedClassifications(copiedMap);

+  /**
